revised_title: In-depth Analysis of Raphanus Self-Incompatibility System
tldr: The article examines the self-incompatibility system in Raphanus plants, revealing that it involves multiple mechanisms. The study compares the cytochemistry and ultrastructure of compatible and incompatible pollinations, providing insights into the complex processes that prevent self-fertilization in this species. The findings contribute to the understanding of plant reproduction and the development of strategies to improve crop yields.
